intro: Rytidosperma alpicola, commonly known as the alpine rytidosperma, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, tufted foliage. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green to brown in color. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to withstand strong winds and low temperatures. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
